page.title: 20FARMING
page.content: Whitchurch lies in a fertile farming area which specialises in{dairying.} The{soil}, mainly clay with pockets of sand , provides excellent pasturage for cattle and sheep , whilst also yielding good corn and root crops.The fields are dominated by friesian cows but some pigs are also kept and Welsh hillsheep often overwinter here.{Crops grown for animal feeding include grass,winter barley,oil-seed rape and arable silage.Potatoes and sugar-beet are also popular with farmers.Goodwins and St.Ivel's dairies in Whitchurch consume locally produced milk which is not only bottled,but also used for cream and cheesemaking.Farm sizes vary from as low as 40 acres to 250 acres plus.Agriculture remains an important local employer but mechanisation has reduced the numbers in farm{ {employment.}
